column2: ENGLISH
Put under House Arrest
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be put under house arrest.
Throw into Oubliette
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be thrown into the Oubliette.
Move to Dungeon
As your prisoner, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! can be moved into a regular dungeon cell.
Castrate [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

As he is your prisoner, you may give the order to castrate §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! and turn him into a eunuch. He will then be a free man, but unable to sire more spawn or hold landed titles. A severe punishment.
column3: Comme il est votre prisonnier, vous pouvez donner l'ordre de castrer §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! et le changer en eunuque. Il sera un homme libre, mais incapable d'engendrer une descendance ou de posséder des terres. Un châtiment sévère.
column4: Als Euer Gefangener habt Ihr das Recht, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! kastrieren zu lassen und ihn zum Eunuchen zu machen. Er ist dann ein freier Mann, doch unfähig Nachkommen zu zeugen oder Grundbesitz sein Eigen zu nennen. Eine schwere Strafe.
column6: Cuando él es preso tuyo, puedes ordenar su castración a §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! y conventirle en eunuco.  De ese modo será un hombre libre, incapaz de engendrar y sin posibilidad de ostentar títulos de hacendado. Un castigo duro.

column2: Blind [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

As [Root.GetSheHe] is your prisoner, you may give the order to permanently blind §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! and then set [Root.GetHerHim] free. This is a common Byzantine way of dealing with political rivals without outright killing them, as a blind [Root.GetManWoman] is of little threat to the throne.
column3: Comme [Root.GetSheHe] est sous votre emprise, vous pouvez donner l'ordre de rendre §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! aveugle de façon permanente avant de [Root.GetHerHim] libérer. Cette pratique byzantine est commune pour se débarrasser des rivaux politiques sans
column4: Da [Root.GetSheHe] Euer Gefangener ist, habt Ihr das Recht, §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! das Augenlicht zu nehmen und [Root.GetHerHim] in die Freiheit zu entlassen. Dies ist die traditionelle byzantinische Art, mit politischen Rivalen umzugehen, ohne sie zu
column6: Cuando [Root.GetSheHe] es preso tuyo, puedes ordenar hacer quedar permanente ciego a §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! y luego poner en libertad a [Root.GetHerHim]. Esto es un modo bizantine común de tratar rivales políticos sin matarles abiertamente, ya que un [Root.GetManWoman] ciego es de poca amenaza para el trono.

column2: Judge [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

By having §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! thrown into a pit in the middle of the desert, [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] shall be exposed to Zun for days and will be most likely given the 'justice' that [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] deserves.
column3: En faisant jeter §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! dans un puits au beau milieu du désert, vous le soumettrez au jugement de Zun pendant plusieurs jours. Il recevra alors la 'justice' qu'il mérite.
column4: Indem wir §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! in einer Grube mitten in der Wüste schmachten lassen, wo er tagelang Zun ausgesetzt sein wird, dürfte ihm die 'Gerechtigkeit' zuteil werden, die er verdient.
column6: Habiendo arrojado a §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! en un pozo en medio del desierto, estará expuesto a Zun durante días y obtendrá, más probablemente, la “justicia” que se merece.

column2: Transfer Prisoner
Because you are at war with §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§!, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] is being held by your vassal, you can request §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! be transferred to your dungeons.
Request [Root.GetTitledFirstName] be moved to your dungeon.
Ransom All Prisoners
column6: Pedir rescate por todos los prisioneros

column2: Make a ransom offer to all prisoners.
column6: Hacer una oferta de rescate a todos tus prisioneros.

column2: Release All Prisoners
Release everyone in your dungeons for free.
column6: Libera a todos los prisioneros sin condiciones.

column2: Execute All Prisoners
Execute everyone in your dungeons.
column6: Ejecuta a todos en las mazmorras.

column2: [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] offers to release me from prison if I pay a ransom.
column6: [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] ofreció liberarte si le pagas un rescate.

column2: I will pay for my freedom.
I will not pay.
I have received a ransom request for one of my courtiers. It is a good deal...
column6: Has recibido una solicitud de rescate por uno de tus cortesanos. Parece un buen trato...

column2: I will pay to get them back.
I will not pay to get them back.
The ransom has been denied!
Well, let them rot...
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to let me out of this filthy dungeon and put me under house arrest. I am even now being moved to a nice room in a tower.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I am to be let out of my hellish, stinking cell and instead put under house arrest. I think I shall need a bath first.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is going to move me out of this cell! That's great! I've been very bored in my cell. It's dirty and there's nobody worth playing with.

Light brightens your room and strange people fuss over you. [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided to put you under house arrest, but you still struggle feebly against the people trying to move you.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName]!
Maybe there'll be toys?
*incomprehensible sounds*
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I should be taken from my comfortable room in the tower and down into the Oubliette! This will truly be the end of me.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I am be taken from my cell and down into the Oubliette! What could I have done to deserve this fate?
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] wants to take me out of my nice room! [Root.Host.GetSubjectPronoun] sent men with swords and everything. I don't want to go.

[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is taking me to something called the oo-blay-ate. I don't know what that is, but I don't wanna go. I just made friends with a rat, and they won't let me take him with me.
Some strange men come into your room and grab you. [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is having you moved into the Oubliette, but you can't understand what they're doing. You go along with it anyway.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] have mercy...
Maybe they'll let me take my wooden pony.
No! Mister Wiggles!
*grumble quietly*
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I should be taken from my comfortable room in the tower and returned to a dungeon cell! Surely this is unnecessary?
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] has decided I shall be allowed out of the cursed oubliette and put into a regular cell. It's not much of an improvement.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] wants to take me out of my nice room! [Root.Host.GetSubjectPronoun] sent men in armor and everything. But I don't want to go.
[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is taking me to a better place. That's what the men in the shiny armor tell me. Maybe it'll be a place with more light?
Some armored men come into your room and grab you. [Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName] is having you moved into the dungeon, but you don't understand and struggle a little in their grip.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap] preserve me!
Thank [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] for small mercies.
Maybe they're releasing me?
It's so dark in here.
*gurgling noises*

My liege, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName], is requesting that I transfer one of my prisoners to [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] dungeons. Because [FromFrom.GetSubjectPronoun] and [From.GetTitledName] are at war with each other, [FromFrom.GetPossPronoun] claim is probably just.
It shall be done.
I think I will keep my prisoner.
[From.GetTitledName] refuses to hand over the prisoner as I commanded.
Curse [From.GetPossPronoun] obstinate nature.
Refused Prisoner Transfer
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be treated better, but security will also be more relaxed.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! health will greatly suffer, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] will be very unlikely to escape.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! health will greatly suffer, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] will be very unlikely to escape. Because [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] is a child, this will be seen as cruel.\n\n
Because this act violates the Jain doctrine of Ahimsa, or non-violence, you will lose §R30.00§! [From.Religion.GetPietyName].\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s§! health will suffer, and [Root.GetSubjectPronoun] will be less likely to escape.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be treated slightly better and still be unlikely to escape.\n\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be castrated and released from prison.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be blinded and released from prison.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! will be taken into the desert.
An order will be sent to §Y[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName]§! for the transfer of the prisoner. §Y[Root.Host.GetTitledFirstName]§! may choose to disobey your command.\n\n
Has prisoners who can be ransomed.\n
Has not recently sent ransom requests.
This will upset the people of each prisoner's home realm, lowering their opinion of you by §R-10§!.\n
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! dies! You lose §R10.00§! [Root.Religion.GetPietyName].\n
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! dies!\n
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! dies! You lose §R10.00§! [Root.Religion.GetPietyName] and gain '§YKinslayer§!'\n
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! dies! You gain '§YKinslayer§!'\n
§Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! is asked to pay ransom.
column6: Al personaje se le ha pedido pagar el rescate.

column2: §Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! is released from your dungeon and imprisoned by §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!.
